definition: to bow to one another/to kneel and kowtow to one another/formal kowtow as part of traditional wedding ceremony
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
to share nuptial cup/(fig.) to get married
formal exchange of cups of wine between bride and groom as traditional wedding ceremony
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
attendant of the bride or bridegroom at a wedding
first return of bride to her parental home
to bow again/to bow twice (gesture of respect in former times)/(in letters, an expression of respect)
